application/manager.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * @file application/manager.h
00003  *
00004  * Application management utilitites. This functions allow to run, add and
00005  * manage existing applications.
00006  *
00007  * @todo  How can we read the name of a given application? Should we provide a 
00008  *        function here or do we read the value directly from the configuration
00009  *        registry?
00010  */
00011 
00012 
00013 #pragma once
00014 #include "../storage/persistent.h"
00015 #include "../storage/volatile.h"
00016 #include "../configuration/registry.h"
00017 
00018 
00019 /**
00020  * The different IDs given to the application which can possibly be hosted on
00021  * the target system.
00022  * The number of values in the enumeration gives the maximum number of
00023  * application which can coexist on the target.
00024  */
00025 enum APPLICATION_ID {
00026     APP_0,
00027     APP_1,
00028 };
00029 
00030 
00031 /**
00032  * Loads the application identified by \a appid to the RAM.
00033  *
00034  * @param[in] appid  The identificator for the application to load.
00035  * 
00036  * @return  0 if the application was loaded correctly, an error code if the
00037  *          application failed to load.
00038  */
00039 int application_load(enum APPLICATION_ID appid);
00040 
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Runs the application currently stored in the RAM.
00044  *
00045  * @todo  Will this method ever return if the application starts correctly?
00046  *
00047  * @return  An error code indicating the reason of the failure.
00048  */
00049 int application_run();
00050 
00051 
00052 /**
00053  * Adds the application at \a buffer to the slot identified by \a appid, giving
00054  * it the name \a name.
00055  *
00056  * @param[in] appid   The slot to which write the application to the persistent
00057  *                    storage.
00058  * @param[in] name    The human readable name to give to this application.
00059  * @param[in] buffer  The buffer from which to read the application to be
00060  *                    written.
00061  *
00062  * @return  0 if the operation completed successfully, an error code otherwise.
00063  */
00064 int application_add(enum APPLICATION_ID appid, const char * name,
00065                     const char * buffer);
00066 
00067 
00068 /**
00069  * Removes the application currently located at the slot \a appid from the
00070  * system.
00071  *
00072  * @param[in] appid  The slot in the persistent storage to free up.
00073  *
00074  * @return  0 if the operation completed successfully, an error code otherwise.
00075  */
00076 int application_remove(enum APPLICATION_ID appid);
00077 
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Renames the application currently located at the slot \a appid, giving it the
00081  * name \a name.
00082  *
00083  * @param[in] appid  The slot in the persistent storage where the application to
00084  *                   rename is located.
00085  * @param[in] name   The new name to assign to this application.
00086  */
00087 int application_rename(enum APPLICATION_ID appid, const char * name);
